heading: Harsh Goenka visits restaurant after 3 months, shares pic of menu and dishes. But there's a catch
summary: The restaurant that the industrialist visited was actually a dining experience created by his children. The post quickly managed to garner over 1.2k likes, and netizens also took to the comments section to praise the kids and their efforts.

heading: Was taken to terrorist ward from IPL after-match party, faced 16-17 hours of torture every day: Sreesanth
summary: Former india pacer has revealed that his life changed in a fraction of seconds in 2013. The 37-year-old said that he was having good time in an IPL after-match party and moments after finding himself sitting in the terrorist ward.

heading: Protests staged in Sri Lanka after Sangakkara, Jayawardene questioned over 2011 World Cup fixing allegations
summary: The protest was held against the continuous harassment of Kumar Sanagakkara and other cricketers over unconfirmed match-fixing allegations. Sri Lanka had lost the world cup final match to India at Mumbai's Wankhede stadium by six wickets.

heading: Sonali Bendre remembers sunny beach days with throwback pics: Miss my abs and hair
summary: Sonali Bendre shared two old pictures of herself, where she is seen sporting a bikini with her hair open. Her husband, filmmaker goldie Behl, commented on the post with fire emojis. heading: India deploys Special Forces units in Ladakh amid military standoff with China
summary: Special forces units played a key role in the 2017 surgical strikes against Pakistan-based terror camps. They can be used effectively on the Chinese front if and when needed, sources said. India has more than 12 Special Forces regiments who train on different terrains and have developed specialisation in desert, mountains and jungle terrain.

heading: Virat Kohli showcases his strength by adding a 'clap' twist to Hardik Pandya's jumping push-ups
summary: India skipper Virat Kohli attempted all-rounder Hardik Pandya's 'jumping push-ups' challenge. He aced the challenge by adding a clap twist to it and showcasing his physical strength, strength and strength if it was to move forward and backward. His elder brother and teammate Kru

heading: Abhishek Bachchan on big movies monopolising OTT: I disagree, it suits some people's rhetoric
summary: A lot has changed over the last two decades for junior Bachchan. "you role with the new normal," says The Big Bull actor in an exclusive chat with IndiaToday.in.

heading: Choti Sardarni to Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai: Here's when your favourite TV shows will return
summary: The channel will start airing fresh episodes of Pyar Ki Luka Chuppi from today, July 2, at 7 pm. A couple of shows will be back on the small screen in the coming week.

heading: UP govt to recover Rs 900 crores from teachers using fake degrees to get jobs
summary: As many as 2823 teachers employed by government schools in Uttar Pradesh used fake degrees issued by the Agra University. The state government has decided to recover salaries paid to these teachers, which amounts to an estimated Rs 900 crores.

heading: Bhanumathi and Ramakrishna Movie Review: Salony and Naveen Chandra film has a dignified take on love
summary: Debutant director Srikanth Nagothi?s Bhanumathi and Ramakrishna explores this concept and how women and men in their 30s are often looked upon as 'old'. In our society, people want men and women to get settled before 30 for various reasons. Whether you?re comfortable or not is not their concern

summary: The drills "further complicate the situation, and are detrimental to the relationship between China and ASEAN," a foreign ministry spokeswoman says. The u.s. heading: Fact Check: Have Budweiser employees been pissing in their beer tanks?
summary: A viral screenshot is claiming about the beer brand 'Budweiser' it states that several employees have been pissing in beer tanks for years. This revelation has apparently left beer lovers in utter shock.

heading: Veteran Kannada actor Rajagopal dies at 69 in Bengaluru
summary: Veteran actor was suffering from asthma and kidney-related issues for the past few years. He was often asked to imitate actor Kalpana's voice and was part of more than 600 films and is still considered as one of the best comedians in the industry.

heading: Google Pixel 3a series discontinued in US: Pixel 4a coming soon?
summary: Google has discontinued the Pixel 4a and Pixel 3a XL in the us nearly a year after they were launched as the watered-down versions of the phone. This should indicate that the company is preparing for the arrival of this series that has been in anticipation more than everyone expected.

heading: BSNL extends availability of Rs 299, Rs 491 ADSL broadband plans for 90 days, introduces PV 2399
summary: Bsnl has extended the availability of ADSL broadband plans worth Rs 299 and Rs 491 for a period of 90 days, starting 27th June. heading: Nikon will introduce entry-level Nikon Z5 and three Nikkor Z lenses on July 21
summary: Rumours suggest the company will announce the Nikon Z5 along with new lenses. These lenses will be a part of Nikkor Z series lenses including the much-awaited f/2.8 S. This lens may come with screw-on feature for putting on additional filters. The new camera M10-R may launch on July 19 via live streams in the US

heading: Asus ROG Phone 3 finally gets a release date: Everything you need to know
summary: The Asus ROG Phone 3 will be launched on July 22, 2020, at the game changer event. The company is better known for making gaming laptops and gaming smartphones, especially the ROg series. It will lock horns with Lenovo Legion gaming smartphone which is also slated to launch this year.

heading: Pakistan temporarily bans PUBG, calls it addictive and wastage of time
summary: Pubg has also been cited as one of the reasons for cases of suicide in Pakistan. The temporary ban comes days after india clutched down on 59 Chinese apps and banned them.

heading: Facebook admits sharing users' data with third-party developers
summary: 5000 third-party app developers continued to receive non-public information about users way longer than they should have. The company didn?t receive the number of users who had used the app for the past 90 days. It just revealed personal information including addresses, birthdays, gender, or language spoken was wrongly shared with the apps.

heading: BSNL reintroduces Work at Home plan till 26th July, extends 6 paise cashback offer till 31st July
summary: The work-at-home plan is available in all circles except for the Andaman and Nicobar circles. New subscribers will get 10 Mbps speed till 5GB data per day, the speed is reduced to 1 mbps - the download and upload limit is unlimited with customers getting 1 free e-mail ID and a GB space. heading: Zuckerberg tells Facebook employees that boycotting advertisers will be back soon enough, won?t change policies
summary: Facebook CEO says he won?t change the policies of the company. This was in response to more than 500 advertisers boycotting Facebook as part of?Stop hate for Profit? movement - a threat to small percent of our revenue, or to any percentage of your revenue... Zuckerberg said 'all these advertisers will be back soon enough'

heading: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra images leak, spotted in Mystic Bronze colour
summary: The phone was spotted in?Mystic Bronze? colour, and complete with a triple camera setup on the back. The new leaked images also show the S Pen. There appear to be no real surprises here, with the stylus looking the same as always.

heading: Google Play Store, App Store remove all 59 Chinese apps banned by government?
summary: The list of apps that were banned by the government included UC browser, Shareit, Kwai, CamScanner and others. The apps were nowhere to be found in Apple?s App Store as well, but now there are absolutely no traces of the other 58 apps banned in India.

heading: DuckDuckGo privacy-focused search engine inaccessible in India, company says could be blocked
summary: The privacy-centric search engine seems to be unresponsive on all networks, according to several users in India on Twitter and Reddit. A number of twitter users took to Twitter to report that DuckDuckGo is inaccessible for them on multiple networks - including Reliance Jio and Airtel. heading: OnePlus Nord to bring 5G-enabled Snapdragon 765G SoC, 'flagship-level' cameras, confirms company
summary: The OnePlus Nord will come with a powerful mid-range chipset, the Snapdragon 765G. The information has now been confirmed by Qualcomm's twitter handle and corroborated by u.s. Co-founder, Carl Pei, who in an interview with TechRadar UK, confirmed the device will be powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 750G chips
